attributes.action: Ban firework sales to the public. Ban noisy fireworks. Control public displays.
attributes.additional_details: The stress that the indiscriminate use of noisy fireworks causes to animals cannot be overstated. The number of animals which go missing, spooked by fireworks, or suffer mentally from the noise, or even die from fear, is appalling. This is animal cruelty at its highest level. Only public displays should be allowed on specific days of the year, and noisy fireworks should be banned.
attributes.background: Ban the sale of fireworks to the public. Ban noisy fireworks. Contain public displays to November 4-7, Diwali and New Year’s Eve.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban sale of fireworks to the public and limit sales to licensed displays only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616868

Require a licence to buy or release any fireworks: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/626683

Reduce the decibel limit on fireworks to 85 decibels, to reduce impact: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622900
